body.p: What is the role of red bone marrow in immune function?

multiple_choice.choice: produces immune cells from stem cells
monitors the lymph fluid interacting with invaders
It has no function related to immunity

response.feedback: Correct. Immune cells and other blood cells originate in red bone marrow; some mature in red bone marrow while others move to thymus to mature before moving to other structures in the body.
Incorrect. Secondary lymphoid organs, such as nodes and spleen, have this function.
Incorrect. Lymph fluid collects from tissue fluid and moves to secondary lymph organs through lymph vessels.
Incorrect. Red bone marrow has a very important function in producing immune cells.

part.hint: People taking anti-cancer drugs often have greatly decreased bone marrow activity, leading to a poorly functioning immune system.
